channel.title: Sprites?
channel.description:
I made a game (definitely not a rs private server) and ive been using one giant JPEG for the background (not the most efficient thing ever, but it works)
I heard somewhere that i could use sprites, ive heard of them before but im not sure EXACTLY what they are (i thought i heard that they are small little 1x1 images put together) and i dont know at all how to use them, help?

item.title: Sprites?
item.dc:creator: @k00dr k00dr
item.description:
@k00dr wrote:

Taharok:

Sprites are animated 2d pictures. They are just images painted onto a canvas thousands of times a second to perform precise animations and create a main picture.

I don’t know what you mean by “precise animations”, but smooth animation needs only a few well drawn sprites

[quote=“Ollie, post:6, topic:175758”]supercomputer?
i dont think i ever seen 1000+fps before[/quote]

Although monitors are unable to refresh at that rate…
[/offtopic]

Read full topic

item.title: Sprites?
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“Ollie, post:6, topic:175758”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=236383.msg2012860#msg2012860 date=1201233717]
Sprites are animated 2d pictures. They are just images painted onto a canvas thousands of times a second to perform precise animations and create a main picture.
[/quote]
supercomputer?
i dont think i ever seen 1000+fps before[/quote]

/

[quote=“Taharok, post:5, topic:175758”][quote author=RLN link=topic=236383.msg2014039#msg2014039 date=1201309440]

Sprites are animated 2d pictures. They are just images painted onto a canvas thousands of times a second to perform precise animations and create a main picture.
[/quote]thousands of times per second lol… what kind of computer do you have?

you can load separate tiles then make a map format which can help you lay the tiles out on your screen

Well, games generally use more than one sprite per frame and usually paint from 20-80 fps.[/quote]

Read full topic

item.description:

Sprites are animated 2d pictures. They are just images painted onto a canvas thousands of times a second to perform precise animations and create a main picture.

item.title: Sprites?
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“RLN, post:4, topic:175758”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=236383.msg2012860#msg2012860 date=1201233717]
Sprites are animated 2d pictures. They are just images painted onto a canvas thousands of times a second to perform precise animations and create a main picture.
[/quote]thousands of times per second lol… what kind of computer do you have?

you can load separate tiles then make a map format which can help you lay the tiles out on your screen[/quote]

Well, games generally use more than one sprite per frame and usually paint from 20-80 fps.

blah bah7:

ok, how could i use them?

Look at the image awt library and the ImageIO class docs.

Read full topic

you can load separate tiles then make a map format which can help you lay the tiles out on your screen
